description.lang: FIBARO Door/Window Sensor is a wireless, battery powered reed sensor compatible with the Z-Wave Plus standard. Changing the devices status will automatically send signal to the Z-Wave controller and associated devices.Sensor can be used to trigger scenes and everywhere there is a need for information about opening or closing of doors, windows, garage doors, etc. Opening is detected by separating the sensors body and the magnet.In addition the FIBARO Door/Window Sensor supports one DS18B20 temperature sensor and has one potential free input.The FIBARO Door / Window Sensor is available in seven colors: white, silver, black, ivory, cappuccino, truffle and dark chocolate.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K35uFXoa5c0
Z-Wave Plus Lifeline.Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: DEVICE_RESET_LOCALLY_NOTIFICATION; NOTIFICATION_REPORT; BATTERY_REPORT; SENSOR_MULTILEVEL_REPORT.
Control is assigned to the magnetic sensor and IN input. Opening or closing will result insending BASIC_SET control command to associated devices.

Alarm reports alarms. Alarm frame (SENSOR_ALARM_REPORT) will be sent to associated devices once such an event has been detected. Works ONLY if external sensor connectedunused if Door/Window Sensor selected in parameter 20.

Sensor ZW3 is assigned to the magnetic sensor and IN input. Opening or closing will result in sending BASIC_SET control command to associated devices. Group provides backward compatibility with controllers not supporting Z-Wave+. Only such controllers should be added to this group.Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: SENSOR_BINARY_REPORT.

Tamper ZW3 is assigned to the tamper alarm. Alarm frame will be send to associated devices once tampering has been detected. Group provides backward compatibility with controllers not supporting Z-Wave+. Only such controllers should be added to thisgroup.Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: SENSOR_ALARM_REPORT.
Parameter defines device operation mode.CAUTION: Do not install the magnet if the device is not used as a Door/Window Sensor,as it might lead to the malfunction of the device.
Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor (type - see par. 20)

Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).
Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller and 3rd association group - Alarm. If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value. CAUTION: In order to activate new settings of parameter 20, it is required to remove and re-add the device to the main Z-Wave controller. This parameter is not reset during removal process.

Paramater defines events indicated by the LED. Reducing number of them results in longer battery lifetime. Default setting: 6 (indication of wake up and device tampering). Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2+4=7, means that all indications are enabled.
indication of opening/closing status change (input IN)
indication of wake up (1 x click or using time interval)
Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.
Reporting the cancellation of tamper alarm to 5th association group.
Do not send tamper cancellation report
Allows to enable activation of Z-Wave range test with double click of a TMP button.
This parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.

This parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller. NOTE: Parameter 51 is active only if parameter 50 is not set to 0.
temperature reports based on threshold disabled
temperature threshold (0.1-30 degrees Celsius, 0.1 degrees step)

This parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. NOTE: Temperature measurement is performed before sending any report (regardless of parameter no. 50). Excessive reporting can affect battery lifetime. Reporting on the basis of temperature change (parameter no. 51) is recommended.
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).
Temperature alarms reported to the main Z-Wave controller. Thresholds may be set in parameters no. 55 and 56.
high and low temperature alarms enabled
If temperature is higher than the set value, high temperature notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).
If temperature is lower than the set value, low temperature notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).

The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned to different events. To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. To activate all scenes set the value to 3903. CAUTION: Every activated scene may shorten the battery life.NOTE: Values of parameter 70 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means scenes for openingand closing are sent.NOTE: Scenes with IDs 12 to 15 are active only if parameter 1 is set to 1. In this case scenes with IDs 1 and 2 are sent after a single click.

Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. They are not repeated by the mesh network.NOTE: Values of parameter 71 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means ON/OFF commandsand sensor alarm are sent in Broadcast Mode.

name.lang: ASSOCIATIONS IN Z-WAVE NETWORK SECURITY MODE

description.lang: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group Lifeline.NOTE: Operating in Z-Wave network security mode automatically disables sending alarms in broadcast mode.NOTE: Values of parameter 72 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means 2nd and 3rd group are sent as secure.
none of the groups sent as secure
4th group, Sensor ZW3, sent as secure
5th group, Tamper ZW3, sent as secure
